module.p: ar our is the first person plural possessive determiner, related to the personal pronoun sinn we, us.

Examples from Gairm –
Bha grunnan de ar luchd-leughaidh an dùil, nuair a nochd an àireamh mu dheireadh de Ghairm, gu robh sin a’ strì ri buidheann shònraichte, no duine sònraichte, a chur do ’n Phàrlamaid, agus bha wèireichean an telefon gu math teth, uair no dhà, an déidh dhuinn tighinn o ’n chlò. Thog iad ceàrr sinn. [...]
Some of our readers were expecting [?], when the last issue of Gairm appeared, that that was striving for a particular group [party?], or a particular person, to send to the Parliament, and the telephone wires were pretty hot, for an hour or two [once or twice?], after we came from the printers. They misunderstood us. [...] td. 9, ‘Air an Spiris’
Anns na ràithean ’s na bliadhnachan a tha air thoiseach oirnn, tha fhios gun dig iomadh atharrachadh air Roinn na Gàidhlig sa’ Bh.B.C. [...] A thaobh ciùil, nach bu chòir do ’n Bh.B.C. a bhith ceum air thoiseach air càch, a’ deilbh dhòighean is chruthan ùra, gun dearmad a dhèanamh air na rudan luachmhor a tha nar dìleab? Tha aca ri sùil a chumail air an aois ’s air an òigridh, agus chan eil sinn gun dòchas gun tarraing iad air ais bho shloc nan daolagan pàirt de òigridh na Gàidhlig, agus gu seall iad dhaibh nach do chaill ceòl nan Gaidheal a’ bhuaidh a bha aige air ar sluagh fad cheudan bliadhna. [...]
During the seasons and the years that are ahead of us, it is known that many changes will come to the Gaelic Department of the BBC. [...] On the subject of music, shouldn’t the BBC be a step ahead of the rest, producing new methods and forms, without neglecting the valuable things that are in our inheritance? They have to keep an eye on old age and on the youth, and we are not without hope that they will pull back part of Gaelic-speaking youth from the pit of beetles, and that they will show them that the Gael’s music has not lost the effect that ithas had on our people for hundreds of years. [...] td. 297, ‘Air an Spiris’

Biblical examples –
[...] A nis dh’éirich righ ùr air an Eiphit, do nach b’aithne Ioseph. Agus thubhairt e r’a shluagh, Feuch, tha sluagh chloinn Israeil ni’s lìonmhoire agus ni’s cumhachdaiche na sinne. Thigibh, buineamaid gu seòlta: an t-eagal gu’m fàs iad lìonmhor, agus gu’n tachair e, ’nuair a dh’éireas cogadh, gu’n gabh iadsan mar an ceudna le ’r naimhdibh-ne, agus gu’n cog iad ’nar n-aghaidh, agus gu’n d’théid iad a mach as an tìr. [...]
[...] Now there arose up a new king over Egypt, which knew not Joseph. And he said unto his people, Behold, the people of the children of Israel are more and mightier than we: Come on, let us deal wisely with them; lest they multiply, and it come to pass, that, when there falleth out any war, they join also unto our enemies, and fight against us, and so get them up out of the land. [...] [KJV] Ecsodus I.8–10 emphatic

Examples from Gairm –
Anns na ràithean ’s na bliadhnachan a tha air thoiseach oirnn, tha fhios gun dig iomadh atharrachadh air Roinn na Gàidhlig sa’ Bh.B.C. Dh’ fhàg Eóghan Mac-a- phì a sheula fhéin air an Roinn sin, agus air a’ Bh.B.C. an Albainn gu h-iomlan, agus air dha a nis a dhreuchd a leigeil dheth, dh’ iarramaid taing a thoirt dha airson gach seirbhis a thug e do ar cànain, is ghuidheamaid dhà saorsainn is toileachas ’na shaorsa, agus obair ás ùr anns na raointean a thaghas e.
During the seasons and the years that are ahead of us, it is known that many changes will come to the Gaelic Department of the BBC. Ewan MacPhee has left his own stamp on that Department, and on the BBC in Scotland as a whole, and after him now giving up his job, we would ask for thanks to be given him for all the service he has given to our language, and wish him liberty and pleasure in his freedom, and new work in the areas that he will choose. td. 297, ‘Air an Spiris’
Anns na ràithean ’s na bliadhnachan a tha air thoiseach oirnn, tha fhios gun dig iomadh atharrachadh air Roinn na Gàidhlig sa’ Bh.B.C. [...] A thaobh ciùil, nach bu chòir do ’n Bh.B.C. a bhith ceum air thoiseach air càch, a’ deilbh dhòighean is chruthan ùra, gun dearmad a dhèanamh air na rudan luachmhor a tha nar dìleab? [...]
During the seasons and the years that are ahead of us, it is known that many changes will come to the Gaelic Department of the BBC. [...] On the subject of music, shouldn’t the BBC be a step ahead of the rest, producing new methods and forms, without neglecting the valuable things that are in our inheritance? [...] td. 297, ‘Air an Spiris’
Anns na ràithean ’s na bliadhnachan a tha air thoiseach oirnn, tha fhios gun dig iomadh atharrachadh air Roinn na Gàidhlig sa’ Bh.B.C. [...] Bithidh cuideachadh a dhìth air luchd a’ Bh.B.C., agus ’se an cuideachadh a b’ fheàrr a b’ urrainn dhuinn a thoirt dhaibh ar n-ùidh a nochdadh, le bhith a’ sgrìobhadh thuca, gam moladh is gan càineadh, ag iarraidh tuilleadh tìde do ’n Ghàidhlig, is a’ sealltainn dhaibh gu bheil sinn a’ dèanamh feum de ’n tìde a th’ againn.
During the seasons and the years that are ahead of us, it is known that many changes will come to the Gaelic Department of the BBC. [...] The BBC people will need help, and the best help that we can give them is to show them our interest, by writing to them, praisng them and criticising them, demanding more time for Gaelic, and showing them that we are making use of the time that we have. td. 297, ‘Air an Spiris’

Biblical examples –
[...] A nis dh’éirich righ ùr air an Eiphit, do nach b’aithne Ioseph. Agus thubhairt e r’a shluagh, Feuch, tha sluagh chloinn Israeil ni’s lìonmhoire agus ni’s cumhachdaiche na sinne. Thigibh, buineamaid gu seòlta: an t-eagal gu’m fàs iad lìonmhor, agus gu’n tachair e, ’nuair a dh’éireas cogadh, gu’n gabh iadsan mar an ceudna le ’r naimhdibh-ne, agus gu’n cog iad ’nar n-aghaidh, agus gu’n d’théid iad a mach as an tìr. [...]
[...] Now there arose up a new king over Egypt, which knew not Joseph. And he said unto his people, Behold, the people of the children of Israel are more and mightier than we: Come on, let us deal wisely with them; lest they multiply, and it come to pass, that, when there falleth out any war, they join also unto our enemies, and fight against us, and so get them up out of the land. [...] [KJV] Ecsodus I.8–10 fused
